name: Cindy (singer)
description: {{nihongo|'''Mayumi Yamamoto'''|山本 真裕美|Yamamoto Mayumi|5 May 1958 – 17 December 2001|lede=yes}}, known professionally as '''Cindy''', was a Japanese singer, lyricist, and composer. Originally working in music journalism, she met [[Stevie Wonder]] and worked with him. She later released four albums – ''Love Life'' (1986), ''Angel Touch'' (1990), ''Don't Be Afraid'' (1991), and ''Surprise'' (1997) – and worked as a lyricist and composer for artists like [[Miho Nakayama]]. Since her death, her music has been associated with [[city pop]] and gained popularity among DJs in Japan.
